hackathon-description-text: FOSSCON is a free and open source software conference that include talks and workshops on topics including development, community building, hackerspace activities, and more. Some of the topics previously presented at FOSSCON include: 3D printing, security, protecting your privacy, networking with the local tech community and discovering new technologies.
hackathon-eligibility:
Since this is the first Hack FOSSCON we are capping participation at 50 Hackers so register ASAP. 
Hackers can go solo or in teams.
hackathon-requirements: Hackers are encouraged to demo their unfinished/finshed hacks, ideas, projects in the presentation ceremonies.
hackathon-rules:
Only one rule:
All hacks MUST use free open source software & technologies
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=3401 Market Street, Drexel University, Philadelphia, PA 19104, USA
hackathon-location-address: 3401 Market Street, Drexel University, Philadelphia, PA 19104, USA
hackathon-description-header: Hack FOSSCON is a hackathon where attendees can hack on projects during the event.
